A teen-aged girl gets the horse of her dreams and is trained by an ex-Jockey to participate in London's Grand National Steeplechase. In the course of her progress, the girl meets a vicious aristocrat who offers to fix the race for an exorbitant price. The limo in which the rider and her chaperone enter the race at the line, gives the girl the chance to lose to her patron and potentially ruin his life.<|end_of_text|><|end_of_text|>

Although there is melodrama at the center or rather at the bottom of this film, the story is told beautifully and subtly and the acting is superb.

For a film about the deadly 'Hate Crimes' that happen in this country,the acting performances were not theatrical and the plot and writing was very tasteful. It was as though any victim of violence could walk right into that theater and simply identify with the reactions, the motivations and every scene.

Spirit and Chaos is an artistic biopic of Miyazawa Kenji, a Japanese poet and writer who was active in the early 20th century. Centered on Miyazawa’s own life, the film depicts his adolescence in the country, the ideals he holds about the agricultural, and his ideals in regards to human nature, the struggle against ruling class, and his efforts to spread socialist ideals through youth literature and haiku writing.
